laboratory_examinations.findings: Enlarging 2-cm enhancing mass in the pineal region; no associated hydrocephalus. Revealed multiple cortical tubers and subependymal nodules.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass was shown to enlarge slightly on follow-up MR images.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Diagnosis was SEGA. There were eosinophilic uninucleated giant cells with both hemosiderin and melanin pigmentation.
Gross-total resection of the tumor; no MR imaging evidence of recurrent tumor.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Currently, 1.5 years after surgery, the patient is neurologically intact.
